intro: Tinantia leiocalyx, commonly known as the white-flowered tinantia, is a flowering plant native to Madagascar. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae and is characterized by its slender, climbing stems and small, white or pale pink flowers. The plant produces small, round berries that are typically green when immature and turn red when mature. It thrives in moist, shaded environments and is often found in forest understories. Due to its unique appearance and limited distribution, it is of interest to botanists and conservationists.
